memberdef.name: LookupHost

detaileddescription.para: Resolve a host string to its corresponding network addresses.

parameterdescription.para: The string representing a host. Could be a name or a numerical IP address (IPv6 addresses in their bracketed form are allowed).

simplesect.para: The resulting network addresses to which the specified host string resolved.
Lookup(const std::string&, uint16_t, bool, unsigned int, DNSLookupFn) for additional parameter descriptions.

detaileddescription.para: Resolve a host string to its first corresponding network address.

simplesect.para: The resulting network address to which the specified host string resolved or std::nullopt if host does not resolve to an address.
LookupHost(const std::string&, unsigned int, bool, DNSLookupFn) for additional parameter descriptions.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &name, uint16_t portDefault, bool fAllowLookup, unsigned int nMaxSolutions, DNSLookupFn dns_lookup_function)
memberdef.name: Lookup

detaileddescription.para: Resolve a service string to its corresponding service.

parameterdescription.para: The string representing a service. Could be a name or a numerical IP address (IPv6 addresses should be in their disambiguated bracketed form), optionally followed by a uint16_t port number. (e.g. example.com:8333 or
The default port for resulting services if not specified by the service string.
Whether or not hostname lookups are permitted. If yes, external queries may be performed.
The maximum number of results we want, specifying 0 means "as many solutions as we get."

simplesect.para: The resulting services to which the specified service string resolved.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &name, uint16_t portDefault, bool fAllowLookup, DNSLookupFn dns_lookup_function)
memberdef.name: Lookup

detaileddescription.para: Resolve a service string to its first corresponding service.

simplesect.para: Lookup(const std::string&, uint16_t, bool, unsigned int, DNSLookupFn) for additional parameter descriptions.

detaileddescription.para: Resolve a service string with a numeric IP to its first corresponding service.

simplesect.para: The resulting CService if the resolution was successful, [::]:0 otherwise.
Lookup(const std::string&, uint16_t, bool, unsigned int, DNSLookupFn) for additional parameter descriptions.

detaileddescription.para: Check if a string is a valid UNIX domain socket path

parameterdescription.para: The string provided by the user representing a local path

simplesect.para: Whether the string has proper format, length, and points to an existing file path

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t *data, size_t len, std::chrono::milliseconds timeout, const Sock &sock)
memberdef.name: InterruptibleRecv

detaileddescription.para: Try to read a specified number of bytes from a socket. Please read the "see also" section for more detail.

parameterdescription.para: The buffer where the read bytes should be stored.
The number of bytes to read into the specified buffer.
The total timeout for this read.
The socket (has to be in non-blocking mode) from which to read bytes.

simplesect.para: An IntrRecvError indicating the resulting status of this read. IntrRecvError::OK only if all of the specified number of bytes were read.
This function can be interrupted by calling g_socks5_interrupt(). Sockets can be made non-blocking with Sock::SetNonBlocking().

detaileddescription.para: Convert SOCKS5 reply to an error message

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &strDest, uint16_t port, const ProxyCredentials *auth, const Sock &sock)
memberdef.name: Socks5

detaileddescription.para: Connect to a specified destination service through an already connected SOCKS5 proxy.

parameterdescription.para: The destination fully-qualified domain name.
The destination port.
The credentials with which to authenticate with the specified SOCKS5 proxy.
The SOCKS5 proxy socket.

simplesect.para: Whether or not the operation succeeded.
The specified SOCKS5 proxy socket must already be connected to the SOCKS5 proxy.

detaileddescription.para:
Create a real socket from the operating system.
domain
Communications domain, first argument to the socket(2) syscall.
type
Type of the socket, second argument to the socket(2) syscall.
protocol
The particular protocol to be used with the socket, third argument to the socket(2) syscall.
pointer to the created Sock object or unique_ptr that owns nothing in case of failure

memberdef.argsstring: (bool manual_connection, util::ConstevalFormatString< sizeof...(Args)> fmt, const Args &... args)
memberdef.name: LogConnectFailure

memberdef.argsstring: (const Sock &sock, struct sockaddr *sockaddr, socklen_t len, const std::string &dest_str, bool manual_connection)
memberdef.name: ConnectToSocket

detaileddescription.para: Create a socket and try to connect to the specified service.

parameterdescription.para: The service to which to connect.
Whether or not the connection was manually requested (e.g. through the addnode RPC)

simplesect.para: the connected socket if the operation succeeded, empty unique_ptr otherwise

detaileddescription.para: Set the name proxy to use for all connections to nodes specified by a hostname. After setting this proxy, connecting to a node specified by a hostname won't result in a local lookup of said hostname, rather, connect to the node by asking the name proxy for a proxy connection to the hostname, effectively delegating the hostname lookup to the specified proxy.
This delegation increases privacy for those who set the name proxy as they no longer leak their external hostname queries to their DNS servers.

simplesect.para: Whether or not the operation succeeded.
SOCKS5's support for UDP-over-SOCKS5 has been considered, but no SOCK5 server in common use (most notably Tor) actually implements UDP support, and a DNS resolver is beyond the scope of this project.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Proxy &proxy, const std::string &dest, uint16_t port, bool &proxy_connection_failed)
memberdef.name: ConnectThroughProxy

detaileddescription.para: Connect to a specified destination service through a SOCKS5 proxy by first connecting to the SOCKS5 proxy.

parameterdescription.para: The SOCKS5 proxy.
The destination service to which to connect.
The destination port.
Whether or not the connection to the SOCKS5 proxy failed.

simplesect.para: the connected socket if the operation succeeded. Otherwise an empty unique_ptr.

detaileddescription.para: Parse and resolve a specified subnet string into the appropriate internal representation.

parameterdescription.para: A string representation of a subnet of the form network address [ "/", ( CIDR-style suffix | netmask ) ] e.g. "2001:db8::/32", "192.0.2.0/255.255.255.0" or "8.8.8.8".

simplesect.para: a CSubNet object (that may or may not be valid).

detaileddescription.para:
Determine if a port is "bad" from the perspective of attempting to connect to a node on that port.
doc/p2p-bad-ports.md
port
Port to check.
whether the port is bad

If an IPv6 address belongs to the address range used by the CJDNS network and the CJDNS network is reachable (-cjdnsreachable config is set), then change the type from NET_IPV6 to NET_CJDNS.
service
Address to potentially convert.
a copy of service either unmodified or changed to CJDNS.
Check if a string does not contain any embedded NUL (\0) characters
